definition: to elucidate/to expound/to study and explain
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: In the third place, the article is to expound the current significance of Lin Yutang's esthetic thought of life art.
sentences.chinese: 三是阐发林语堂生活艺术论美学思想的当下意义。

sentences.english: I am an abstract artist, a concrete analyst, and a ruthless bookie.
sentences.chinese: 抽象派艺术家，详细的阐发家，无情的的赌马人。

sentences.english: The third section is the fourth part and is the conclusion part of this thesis.
sentences.chinese: 余论为第五部分，是论文的阐发部分。

sentences.english: The party's new philosophies are little more than their old beliefs writ large.
sentences.chinese: 这个政党的新指道原则无非是其老信条的阐发。

sentences.english: He can elucidate the inner meaning of Confucius' words more specifically.
sentences.chinese: 能更为具体地阐发孔子语的内在意蕴。

sentences.english: Antonio Labriola expounded on the historical materialism is creative.
sentences.chinese: 拉布里奥拉对唯物史观的阐发是富有创造性的。

sentences.english: This article elucidates the significance of developing a commodity economy in our country.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章阐发了在我国发展商品经济的意义。

sentences.english: Fourth, explaining the principle about Liushu and shuowen.
sentences.chinese: 第四，系统地阐发六书与《说文》的条例。

sentences.english: Ms. Ye Jiaying has a profound elaboration of Mr. Wang Guowei's "theory of realm".
sentences.chinese: 叶嘉莹先生对王国维的境界说作了深刻的阐发。

sentences.english: Others remained keen to make a point.
sentences.chinese: 另外一些人还在热衷于阐发观点。

sentences.english: This was also a point of view developed at length by the gestalt psychologist Rudolph Arnheim.
sentences.chinese: 这也是格式塔心理学家详细阐发的一个观点。

sentences.english: Our ancient music appearance-sprite theory attained the perfect state by his elucidating .
sentences.chinese: 经过嵇康的阐发，我国古代音乐形神理论终臻完备。

sentences.english: She amplified on her remarks with drawings and figures.
sentences.chinese: 她通过图画和数字进一步阐发她的话。

definition: doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
to expound (a position)/to elaborate (on a topic)/to treat (a subject)
to compose (a piece of writing)/to write/(written) work/writer
